text: [Music]
hi everyone Anthony Fantana here
the Internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review grizzly bear
shields counter chesta
[Music]
I'm an grizzly bear is a New York band
consisting of Chris Taylor
Christopher bear daniel rossen and Edie
drost and it's kind of weird for me to
think it's been like six years since I
first heard of these guys thanks to the
release of one of my favorite indie
psychedelic folk records ever yellow
house it's an album that is very
pleasant
and gentle on the ears but is extremely
bold in its vastness and very complex
baroque instrumentation there are plenty
of experimental and progressive song
structures all over this LP too and it's
also important to note that this LP kind
of comes with the addition of two
members beforehand grizzly bear was
pretty much Edie and Christopher bear on
drums but together Edie and Daniel made
a really fantastic songwriting team on
this LP just one great tune after
another with lullaby and central remote
knife and little brother which there is
an amazing electric version of on the
friend EP in between yellow house and
the friend EP what those you know albums
or releases were kind of forecasting I
thought grizzly bear would definitely be
a favorite band of mine for years and
years to come but then they put out
their next full-length album the Cata
nest and while that LP did bring them a
lot more fans gained a lot more
attention for them it wasn't really a
love at first listen for me there's some
really strong singles on this LP for
sure some of the catchiest songs of 2009
like the bright piano chord smashing
track two weeks even though it was
catchy er even though it was a bit more
straightforward and that I'm sure you
know made it appeal to a lot of people I
for one was was missing the kind of
excessive instrumentation you know the
the heavy interludes the massive
crescendos you know there were still
some subtle and and refined tracks on
there like Dori and and I do like the
album for me it just really kind of felt
like a step in a direction that that I
wouldn't really care for if I felt
grizzly-bear went into that direction
any further now we have grizzly bears
latest LP their fourth full-length LP
shields and the T is toward the release
of this album by first releasing the
track sleeping ute which was pretty
quiet for a single and brought back that
kind of multi phase progressive
songwriting that I loved hearing grizzly
bear partake in for me a kind of signal
a return back in that direction and I
did kind of get that on this album but
only to an extent and I'm going to be
completely straightforward with this I
feel like personally I got that only to
the extent that the end product that we
have here with shields is is kind of a
middle-of-the-road record for grizzly
bear to kind of measure things up to
economists a little bit there's not a
single track on here that is as joyfully
infectious as any number of tracks on
that album especially two weeks so while
things are not really that poppy or
catchy on this album except for a few
moments maybe yet again being an example
of that but still not really kind of a
climactic pop enos or just an explosive
popping us on that track maybe more of a
subtle pop enos to continue the band has
also not tried to approach the same
level of lavishness and and detailed
orchestration that i know they're
capable of thanks to the choir version
of an alligator off that friend EP I
mentioned I just kind of feel like
overall on this record I'm getting less
finesse less detail and less volume as
well the strongest tracks on this LP in
my opinion are the ones that were
released beforehand sleeping you is a
great tune like I said goes back to that
more progressive structure grizzly bear
kind of brings a surprise into the mix
with these psychedelic arpeggiating
synthesizers and a really strong
explosive hook and the track yet again
has a really nice groove too I love the
very huge gargantuan just grandly strum
guitar chords but
just kind of cascading all over the mix
and the ending is is something kind of
different or interesting for grizzly
bear I mean it's just a really loud
noisy chaotic freak out the rest of the
songs on here for the most part I feel
like they're likable but are also kind
of mild like the track the hunt a quiet
song kind of subtle song there is
instrumentation kind of hanging in the
background on the track and the hook is
very painful cuts like a knife but the
verse melody coming from the vocals is
just dull dull dull and a simple answer
has got to be my least favorite track on
this LP it's just loaded with these very
ham fisted piano chords
thumping throughout the track that just
have no grace to them whatsoever it's
kind of like if you could imagine a
morbidly obese ballerina stumbling out
of stage in front of an audience of
thousands also this track is one of the
longest on on the album and and one of
the most needlessly repetitive songs
that grizzly bear has ever written the
track gun-shy also lacks an interesting
approach it's it's just way too
straightforward way to surface but at
least that song is definitely more sweet
on the ears and I could see that growing
on me for sure right after that the song
half gate kind of brings those strings
that I wish came in on gun-shy but
they're just applied so lazily on this
track the strings are just piled onto
this track like dirt from the grave that
these guys are digging for their old
sound apparently the closer Sun in your
eyes is the only other track on this LP
that I really kind of felt love for it's
a very climactic finish and it's
multi-phase very progressive just like
the song that kind of kicked things off
I kind of loved how you had that moment
of quiet as the song comes to an end the
pianos there and then the ending kind of
builds up into this very synthesizer
heavy crescendo the vocal harmonies are
wonderful and even though that moment of
enjoyment is there as I finished the
album I still kind of leave this thing
being a little underwhelmed I will say
for the most part the songwriting is
there and for sure the recording quality
is is there everything
sounds good but there's just not that
level of ambition and detail and an
instrumentation that I have come to
expect and enjoy from grizzly-bear I
still did like this I liked a majority
of tracks on this but I think this is
easily grizzly bears spa deist release
so far but what do you guys think of it
let me know kind of feeling a decent two
strong six on this thing what did you
guys think of it if you've given it a
listen did you love it did you hate it
why what should i review next and
anthony Fantana grizzly bear
only the strong subscribe forever
